page.title: 15Wild Flowers
page.content: Wild flowers are living in Hollinsclough because they do not get disturbed. Fields on steep hillsides are not fertilized or reseeded. Also the Peak National Park was set up to care for the countryside, plants and animals. Two ecologists came to school and we visited five different sites to see wild flowers on Hollins hill we saw several large fairy rings purple orchids and wild pansies.In the reseeded field were lots of docks and dandelions .We went onto High Edge a limestone pavement lots of wood sorrel grows in the cracks .Lower down the hill by the stream we found many flowers bitter vetch, violet, double-sided saxifrage, marsh valarian, lady's smock, marsh marigold, primrose, bluebell and many others. It is a good thing to be in the National Park,we are lucky to live here
